intro: Erysimastrum substrigosum, commonly known as the roughleaf erysimastrum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are hairy and rough, providing a distinctive texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Erysimastrum substrigosum is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these regions.
